p: Although HPeV3 infection is widespread among children in Japan, epidemic myalgia associated with HPeV3 infection has been reported among adults and children from limited areas of Japan; thus, it was once referred to as an “unusual outbreak” in Japan ( 8). This might be, at least in part, because of the difficulty in accurately diagnosing epidemic myalgia associated with HPeV3 infection, due to the lack of awareness of this disease. Therefore, we present the case of a patient with epidemic myalgia and a confirmed HPeV3 infection.
